My name is Dan Negrey and I am a data scientist based in Cleveland, OH. My career has centered around marketing analytics but I am genuinely interested in all things data, especially when it involves the use of open-source technology. In particular, I love using [R](https://www.r-project.org/) with [Shiny](https://shiny.rstudio.com/) and [R Markdown](https://rmarkdown.rstudio.com/) to build powerful data tools, dashboards and reports. I studied mathematics at [Ohio University](https://www.ohio.edu/) where I earned a Master of Science degree in 2007.

![Thoughts on technology](technology.png) \

#### My approach

Over the years I have developed a consistent approach to tackling data science problems, which centers around four key components and emphasizes reproducibility:

1. **Getting data** (*querying an API or database, scraping a website, importing flat files, etc.*)
2. **Cleaning data** (*scrubbing, keying, joining, filtering, etc.*)
3. **Analyzing data** (*exploring, aggregating, modeling, visualizing, etc.*)
4. **Publishing results** (*knitting a report, updating a dashboard, emailing a summary, etc.*)

![R package workflow](package-workflow.png) \
